title: wow, my little town made the nytimes.

content: the koch foods plant they showed the pic of used to be constaltly raided, the usual catch from there was 120 at a time, but they haven't raided it in over 4 yrs. it's also the place where numerous id theft are committed. there has been people as far away as california have their ssn used at this plant, and nothing has been done by local goevernment. these people have driven wages down, if you go by the ss office or the welfare office you can't get in, at the dmv, you have to make an appointment to get your license renewed, our violent crime rate has increased, drugs are everywhere now, hep a,b, and c along with some tb cases are on the rise, there are 2 sections in town that have gone from nice to slums, the school system is drained because the school board would rather pay for tranlators versus books, out of the two hospitals, one filed chapter 11 because of over $400M debt from treating illegals, it has now been bought by doctors and is a private hospital, our county jail is 98% hispanic, although they haven't made much noise outside the hispanic community, ms-13 is here. and the ny times think i feel sorry for them? the one auto factory they showed with an empty parking lot is where i used to work, there was no hispanics working there! out of all the americans they showed, all but one came from this plant, the lone exception being the guy at five rivers career center, but they are overwhelemd, (btw our jobs went to mexico!), there is always a protest from the illegals here, but when someone tries to protest the illegals, they can't get a permit or the permit gets pulled before it starts. the most violent place in town is in the heart of the hispanic community, there are two bars there that will serve anyone, including juveniles, but they will not even attempt to raid it, even though on any given night you can drive by there and see drug deals being made constantly, but the police will not enter their parking lot. no wonder america is in such pityful shape, people worrying about people that shouldn't even be here to start with!

The ONLY effective way to end the illegal worker problem is go after the COMPANIES and MANAGERS that hire the illegals or look the other way when others in the company hire the illegals. They also need to especially go after companies that RECRUIT illegals and that help illegals get "documentation" that makes them look like they are legal workers. Once compnaies are paying fines big enough to affect profits and a few CEOs and other top managers spend some time in jail and pay big fines companies will find cheap legal ways to determine who is a legal worker rather than find excuses to not check.
